item.summary: Page Jumps During Editing with Table of Contents Macro in Safari
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary In Confluence Cloud editor, the page experiences erratic jumping behavior when editing a page that includes the Table of Contents (TOC) macro. This issue occurs exclusively in the Safari browser and is not present in Chrome or Firefox. Removing the TOC macro resolves the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open Confluence Cloud in the Safari browser. # Create or open a page with multiple headings. # Insert the Table of Contents macro to the page. # Begin editing the page content below the headings at the bottom or anywhere in between the page.
h3. Expected Results The page intermittently jumps or shifts position during editing, disrupting the editing process.
h3. Actual Results The page should remain stable during editing, with no unexpected jumps or shifts, regardless of the presence of the TOC macro. The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
h3. Workaround Remove the Table of Contents macro to prevent the page from jumping while editing in Safari.
OR
Trying using other browsers like Chrome or Firefox.

item.summary: Text Jumps to Cursor Position in Code Snippet Macro on Firefox
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary In the Confluence Cloud editor, when using the Code Snippet macro in the Firefox browser, the text of the line below unexpectedly moves up to the cursor position. This issue does not occur in the Chrome browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open Confluence Cloud in Firefox. # Navigate to a page and enter the editing mode. # Insert a Code Snippet macro into the page. # Type multiple lines of code within the macro. # Move the cursor to the end of a line above another line of text. # Continue typing or press Enter.
h3. Expected Results The text from the line below unexpectedly moves up to the cursor position.
h3. Actual Results The text from the line below should remain in its original position, and the cursor should not cause any unexpected text movement.
h3. Workaround Use the Chrome browser to edit pages with the Code Snippet macro, as this issue does not occur in Chrome.

item.summary: Filtering for empty or non-empty tag fields in Databases does not work as expected
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When filtering a Confluence Database for a tag field being empty or non-empty, it treats empty tag fields as not being empty if they have *ever* had a value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a database that has a field with the tag type. # Fill in some of the fields with tags and notate which ones have ever had tags. # remove all tags from at least one row that has had a tag. # create a filter, and filter for the tag field for "is not empty"
h3. Expected Results
Only rows with values in the field show up
h3. Actual Results
Any rows that have *ever* had a value, including those that no longer have any values will show up instead.
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to create new rows and copy all other fields into the row to make the field for that row "empty" again, or to filter for all possible values.

item.summary: Live docs titles can't be updated through REST API v2

item.summary: PDF Export issue: Images in included Confluence pages display "Preview Unavailable"
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we use the "Include Page" macro to insert a Confluence page into another page, the expected behavior is that the receiving page displays all images and content from the included page. While the images appear correctly on the Confluence page, exporting the combined page to PDF results in images under the "Include Page" macro showing as "Preview unavailable" instead of displaying the original image.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Confluence page (Page A) with images. # Create another Confluence page (Page B) and use the "Include Page" macro to insert Page A. # Export Page B to PDF.
h3. Expected Results The exported PDF should display all images from both the main page and the included page correctly.
h3. Actual Results
In the exported PDF, images from the included page display as "Preview unavailable" rather than showing the actual images.

item.summary: Keyboard shortcut added to ContentAction doesn't open the module.
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Keyboard shortcuts added to {{ContentAction}} in a Forge app are being displayed as capital letters and do not function as expected to open the module.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Forge app using the {{confluence-content-action}} template. # Add a keyboard shortcut to the manifest file: {code:json} keyboardShortcut: accelerator: shift+d {code} # Deploy the Forge app. # Navigate to a Confluence page and open the More Actions menu (...). # Go to Apps -> Observe the tooltip displaying the shortcut in capital letters. # Attempt to use the shortcut (both lowercase and uppercase).
h3. Expected Results * The tooltip should correctly display the shortcut without translating it to capital letters unless it requires a capital letter. * Pressing the defined shortcut (Shift+D) should open the module directly, regardless of current navigation focus.
h3. Actual Results * The tooltip displays the shortcut in capital letters. * Pressing the shortcut, whether in lowercase or uppercase, only opens the More Actions menu instead of directly opening the module.
h3. Workaround
Navigate to the *More Actions(...)* -> *Apps* -> selects your app , and then press the shortcut keys. It works in both lowercase and capital letters.

[^UnsupportedMacro.mov] h3. Expected Results
Image showing properly in both edit and view mode h3. Actual Results

It can’t be edited because it is now incompatible with the current editor. {quote} h3. Workaround

item.summary: Timeout in Edit Mode When Using TOC Macro Inside Scroll Ignore Macro
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We have identified a timeout issue occurring in *Edit mode* when the *TOC macro* is placed inside the {*}Scroll Ignore macro{*}. While macros load correctly in {*}View mode{*}, in {*}Edit mode{*}, all macros fail to load due to the timeout, preventing users from editing the page. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Insert a *Scroll Ignore macro* on a Confluence Cloud page.
# Inside the Scroll Ignore macro, insert a {*}Table of Contents (TOC) macro{*}.
# Save the page and switch between View and Edit modes.
# In {*}View mode{*}, the macros render correctly.
# In {*}Edit mode{*}, the macros do not load, and the page times out.
h3. Expected Results
The TOC and Scroll Ignore macros should function correctly in both View and Edit modes. h3. Actual Results * The page fails to load macros in Edit mode due to a timeout.
* A *503 error* appears in the logs, suggesting that Confluence is dropping the request.
* The *cc-proxy logs* indicate slow API calls.
h3. Workaround
Moving the TOC macro *outside* the Scroll Ignore macro allows the page to load in Edit mode.

item.summary: PDF export V2 is slow for custom exports on the space level

Below is an example of an export with space that only has a few pages containing just a few text:
!image-2025-03-26-10-14-12-329.png|width=268,height=169!
In some cases, it goes all the way up to 1 hour or more.
*(!) The issue only seems to impact the custom export. Page-level exports are performing better.* h3. Steps to Reproduce # Export a space using the "custom" option # Select one or two small pages # Start the export
h3. Expected Results
PDF export finishes in a reasonable amount of time h3. Actual Results
PDF export takes much longer in relation to the amount of content within the selected pages to be exported h3. Workaround
Use page-level exports

item.summary: Header: Inaccurate alt text specified for interactive image
item.description: h3. Issue Summary An inaccurate textual description "Custom logo" is specified for the "CG Logo" image link. h3. Note: To resolve the current bug, it is necessary to implement a feature that enables administrators to add alt text for the custom logo. This functionality should be flexible enough to allow admins to customize the alt text according to their organization's specific requirements. Feature Request Link: [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-81193] h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open the Confluence Cloud instance with custom logo present. # Using a screen reader, navigate to the mentioned image link in the header section. # Listen that the textual description is not describing the functionality of the image link. h3. Screen Recording [^Inaccurate Alt Text.mp4] h3. Actual Results When screen reader users navigate through the header section in Confluence, the "CG Logo" informative image link is announced as "Custom logo", which does not accurately convey the information visually represented by the image. The issue occurs because inaccurate alt text has been provided in the "alt" attribute. As a result, this creates a poor experience for screen reader users. h3. Expected Results Ensure that the accurate textual description of the image is read out by the screen reader. Apply the following changes: * Provide an appropriate and accurate textual description for the informative image. * Ensure that the textual description accurately reflects the purpose of the image. * In this case, ensure that the textual description for the mentioned image link is "CG Confluence Homepage". h3. Code Snippet: *Syntax:* *Correct code Example:* h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available h3. item.summary: Problem render Jira issues description field data containing '{}' in table format on Jira legacy macro
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Legacy macro in Jira issues interprets text within curly braces '{}' in issue descriptions as special values. This interpretation causes table rows containing '{}' to collapse into a single row, which distorts the table data format. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create an issue in Jira and feed the description filed with the table # Fill out rows with data containing '{}'. like API calls with variables included. e.g. POST questions-list/questionnaire/v2/\{questionnaire-responses}/123 # Use Jira legacy macro on Confluence Cloud and include a description field as well. # Then publish the Confluence page
h3. Expected Results
On the Confluence page, The Jira issues description field should render the table data in the original format similar to how it appears on the Jira issue h3. Actual Results
The table will be rendered with a few rows collapsed into a single row. h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to replace the '{}' with any other symbols like '<>'

item.summary: Confluence Analytics records presenting discrepancies between number of created pages
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since Confluence Analytics numbers are based on events triggered by actions taken on pages (creation, updates, etc.), on a few specific occasions, those events may either be duplicated or missed, resulting in discrepancies between the actual number of pages created by a user and what is displayed within Analytics screens.
The discrepancies may be either bigger (potential duplicate events) or lower (potential missed events) numbers than the actual value. h3. Steps to Reproduce
So far we have not been able to reproduce the issue consistently, but already gathered multiple case examples for analysis. h3. Expected Results
Numbers matching between DB queries and Analytics h3. Actual Results
Discrepancies between the number of pages created in DB vs Analytics h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to manually search and count the pages from a given user – which we understand is not feasible in most cases.

item.summary: Page: Nameless button is found in the confluence IOS app

On the "Confluence iOS app" there is a "Restriction" icon button is available which does not have accessible name. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open the "Confluence" app in any iPhone. # Using voice over Create a project and publish 1 page. # Now observe that there is a "Lock" icon button. # Navigate to that button and listen to the output of the voice over. # Observe that it is announced as "button" only.
h3. Screen Recording
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/488135/Nameless%20button h3. Actual Results
When a user navigates to the "Restriction" icon button on any published Confluence page, it is missing an accessible name and is announced only as "button". This issue occurs exclusively in the iOS mobile app when navigating with the VoiceOver screen reader. As a result, VoiceOver screen reader users are unable to effectively understand the purpose of the button. h3. Expected Results
The "Restriction" icon button should have an accessible name that is clearly communicated to screen reader users. This name should be both unique and sufficiently descriptive to convey the button's function effectively.
For further guidance on accessibility best practices, refer to the following resources: * [Icon buttons should be labeled with aria-label|https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/day-16-icon-buttons-should-be-labelled-with-aria-label-551g] * [How to fix common iOS accessibility issues|https://www.deque.com/blog/how-to-fix-common-ios-accessibility-issues/]
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available h3. Environment

item.summary: Inserting a base64 image in the Confluence endpoint, and after editing the page, the image disapears from the published page
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a base64 image into a Confluence page via the [API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-page/#api-pages-post], the image disappears from the published page after editing the page in the UI mode. h3. Steps to Reproduce * Use the [Confluence API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-page/#api-pages-post] to insert a base64 image into a page. * Publish the page and verify that the image is displayed correctly. * Edit the page using the native Confluence editor. * Publish the page again after making any edit.
h3. Expected Results
The base64 image should remain visible on the published page even after any edits are made. h3. Actual Results
After editing and republishing the page, the base64 image disappears from the published page. h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

comments.text: We are trying to migrate our documentation base to Confluence and this is a critical feature needed. It affects our ability to update documentation.
comments.author: Aris Ariawan

comments.text:
Hi everyone, This is Vinodh from the Confluence team. Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention.
This behavior of images being uploaded to Confluence in base64 not being retained intentionally works this way as we do not support uploading images in base64 to Confluence.
To set the right expectations, we are closing this bug as ‘Won’t Fix' as we do not have any plans to change the behavior of this feature. If this behavior has a significant impact on your work, please share examples with us to help us understand your use cases when using this feature.
Thank you again for providing valuable feedback to our team! I will be marking it as closed for now.
Vinodh N.
comments.author: Vinodh Nagarajan

item.summary: Get footer comment versions API endpoint exhibiting inconsistent behavior
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the [Get footer comment versions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-version/#api-footer-comments-id-versions-get] endpoint, specific behaviors occur if the page linked to the comment has been deleted: * If there is only one version of the comment, the endpoint returns an empty response.
* If multiple versions of the comment exist, the response will exclude the latest version of the comment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Add a footer comment to a page and save the changes. # Update the footer comment by using the Edit button on the footer comment and save the modifications. # Update the same footer comment once more and save the changes. # Utilize the [Get footer comments for page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-comment/#api-pages-id-footer-comments-get] REST API endpoint to retrieve the footer comments ID. # Utilize the [Get footer comment versions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-version/#api-footer-comments-id-versions-get] endpoint to obtain the versions of the comments, where all versions will be returned. # Delete the page where the comment was added and retain it in the trash. # Utilize the [Get footer comment versions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-version/#api-footer-comments-id-versions-get] endpoint to retrieve the versions of the comments.
h3. Expected Results * It is expected that all versions of the comment is returned.
h3. Actual Results * If there is only one version of the comment, it returns an empty response.
* If there are multiple versions of the comment, the response does not include the latest version of the comment.
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: Copy Confluence data migrates whiteboards containing the content in the page tree but not the actual data.
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copy Confluence data migrates whiteboards containing the content in the page tree but not the actual data.
As per [What product data is copied|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/what-product-data-is-copied/] the whiteboards are not supposed to be copied. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Whiteboard on a space on a cloud site. # Use Copy product data to migrate the space containing the whiteboard to another cloud site.
h3. Expected Results
As per [What product data is copied|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/what-product-data-is-copied/] the whiteboards are not supposed to be copied. h3. Actual Results * The content in the page tree is copied but not the actual data.
*Source:*
<Source_site>/wiki/spaces/MIG1/whiteboard/164038?atl_f=PAGETREE
!image-2025-02-18-13-13-11-645.png|width=513,height=274!
*Destination:*
<Destintaion_site>/wiki/spaces/MIG1/whiteboard/106430520?atl_f=PAGETREE
!image-2025-02-18-13-13-24-865.png|width=504,height=216! h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

comments.text:
Hi [~e0621f72df9f] . I am an engineer from the Confluence Whiteboards team.
Whiteboards currently support only one form of migration — Site BRIE (backup and restore).
Copy Confluence (aka C2C — [see different migration types|https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CCM/pages/3859718123/What+are+the+different+migration+types#Copy-Product-Data-(C2C)]) is currently not supported. We plan to support it when we implement Space Backup/Restore. Our PM ([~9ea5d2862e41]) is the person to speak to around when it is likely that we will prioritise this feature.
comments.author: Hady Osman

comments.text:
Aligned with whiteboards PM ([~9ea5d2862e41]) that this is not meant to be on the WB's side. Whiteboards do not support space backup/restore yet and so the importing logic in the importer service should not be creating records for these.
This requires a fix in the importer service. Changing the component to [Migrations - Space - Import|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project+%3D+CONFCLOUD+AND+component+%3D+%22Migrations+-+Space+-+Import%22]
comments.author: Jaro

item.summary: Archiving a Confluence page tamper the page version history
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The UI action (archive page) modifies the 'createdAt' field of the last edition when checked against the response request of the following endpoint [Get page by id .|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-page/#api-pages-id-get] h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create or choose a page
# Publish it
# Get the page by id with [The Confluence Cloud REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v2/api-group-page/#api-pages-id-get] , use header {{include-versions}} with the boolean value {{{}true{}}}; check the field {{createdAt}} from the most recent version.
# Go back to the page in Confluence, archive the page
# Re-do step 3
h3. Expected Results
Changes in the status only and createdAt unchanged.
h3. Actual Results
The createdAt field changes. (Seems like it's having a modifiedAt or lastModified behaviour) h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

comments.text:
At first glance it seems this bug could corrupt content audit trails broadly and/or influence how Guard Detect and Guard Premium might treat Confluence content, as well as influence Legal Discovery against Confluence content that customers are trying to perform (archived pages appear as Created At within the discovery timeframe, instead of correctly outside of it). And finally there are several third party vendors that rely on page and version metadata to manage content, including Midori Better Archiving, B1NARY Breeze Content Management, Bordant's Automatic Archiving, Ricksoft's Pages Manager... likely others.
Are you sure that overwriting the version metadata is currently _correctly_ set at such a Low priority and Minor Sev? /cc @[lmehrkens@atlassian.com|mailto:lmehrkens@atlassian.com] @[mtse@atlassian.com|mailto:mtse@atlassian.com]
comments.author: Nick Wade -Opus Guard-

comments.text:
Checking back in a month on. The priority remains low and the severity minor, despite what I can reasonably guesstimate is at minimum 1,550+ customers affected (the publicly available Cloud installs numbers of Midori Better Content Archiving + other archiving apps in Marketplace) HOWEVER this issue affects any customer that Archives any page in Confluence Cloud. Affected customers would be any Confluence Cloud customer site that has ever called Archive Page more than 0 times. This seems likely to be a lot.
Again, with broad exposure, I'm struggling to understand the Low / Sev 3 and hiding in JAC state of this report.
comments.author: Nick Wade -Opus Guard-

item.summary: Trying to manage Space Watchers with large amount of entries times out the UI
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to manage Watchers from a Space, if there are a large amount of Watchers on the Space the UI element can time out and throw a generic error.
!Screenshot 2025-02-05 at 16.23.43.png|width=205,height=107! h3. Steps to Reproduce * On any page, click Watcher icon. * On tooltip popup, click 'Mange Watchers' * Change selection from Page to Space. ** If there are a large number of Watchers, the UI will time out.
h3. Expected Results
UI will load Space Watchers and allow removal and addition of watchers. h3. Actual Results
UI times out performing backend permissions checks. {code:java} [{errors: [{,…}], data: {spaceWatchers: null}}] 0: {errors: [{,…}], data: {spaceWatchers: null}} data: {spaceWatchers: null} spaceWatchers: null
errors: [{,…}] 0: {,…} extensions: {classification: "DataFetchingException"} locations: [] message: "Exception querying the remote GraphQL service: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: 10,000 milliseconds timeout on connection http-outgoing-444618 [ACTIVE]" path: ["spaceWatchers"] 0: "spaceWatchers" {code} h3. Workaround
You can leverage the [Remove Space Watch|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/v1/api-group-content-watches/#api-wiki-rest-api-user-watch-space-spacekey-delete] API call to lower the number of watchers on the Space. Once the number is low enough, the UI should recover.

item.summary: Using the shortcut to add an image in Confluence Cloud allows selection but fails without permissions
item.description:
h3. Problem
In Confluence Cloud, when a user lacks permissions to add or delete attachments in a space, they cannot upload files while editing a page. The editor menu bar option for "Add Image, Video or file" is not visible.
(!) However, when using the shortcut (/image) in the editor, the option appears but fails to function, leading to user confusion. h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Ensure the user does not have permission to add or delete attachments in a space. # Open a page in edit mode. # Attempt to add an image via the editor menu bar (option is not available). # Use the /image shortcut to add an image.
h3. Expected Results
When a user without attachment permissions attempts to add an image using the shortcut, they should receive a warning about their lack of permissions, or the shortcut should not be available. h3. Actual Results
The shortcut option appears, and users can attempt to add an image, but the action fails without any warning, causing confusion. h3. Workaround
There is no workaround available; Users need to be informed about their permissions before attempting to use the shortcut. h3. Notes
The issue causes confusion for users who are unaware of their permission limitations. Enhancing the user interface to prevent the appearance of the shortcut, or providing a clear warning message, *would improve the user experience.*

item.summary: Fix Jira Issue macros in Confluence cloud
item.description:
h3. Summary
There are Jira issue macros with URLs such as {noformat} <ac:structured-macro ac:name="jiraissues" ac:schema-version="1" ac:macro-id="ca8f02ed-018d-43c6-a8da-xxxxxxxxxxxx"> <ac:parameter ac:name="cache">off</ac:parameter> <ac:parameter ac:name="count">true</ac:parameter> <ac:parameter ac:name="title">Umgesetzte Änderungen</ac:parameter> <ac:parameter ac:name="url"><ri:url ri:value="https://{cloud-url}.atlassian.net/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/21119/SearchRequest-21119.xml?tempMax=1000" /></ac:parameter> <ac:parameter ac:name="height">250</ac:parameter> </ac:structured-macro>
{noformat} Even after updating the base URL as you can see in the above metadata, the macros is still not fixed. h3. Observation
When visiting the partially fixed link from the storage format {code:java} https://{cloud-site}.atlassian.net/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/21119/SearchRequest-21119.xml?tempMax=1000{code} We get an "XSRF Security Token Missing", this may be due to an OAuth error. In Jira and Confluence Cloud, we regularly run health checks to ensure that the OAuth connection is secure. Any time Jira searches are run from outside Jira (Confluence is outside Jira), then a valid, non-expired token is required. To replicate, if we go to: {noformat} > https://{cloud-site}.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=21119 > Then click "Export" (top right corner) > Then click "Export XML", and then we'll see a valid search. > If we inspect the URL bar, you will see: > https://{cloud-site}.atlassian.net/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/21119/SearchRequest-21119.xml?atl_token=549xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx48_lin&tempMax=1000{noformat} The addition of an "atl_token" parameter. This is missing from the Jira issue macro in Confluence - it is not able to perform an authenticated valid search as it is missing a token. h3. Next Steps:
There is no known workaround.

# Create an automation rule ## "When Page published" ## If user condition, the user who triggered the user event is -> Your name ## Then send email to email address with body "{{{}page.url{}}}" # Create a page to trigger the above automation rule # Check the link thats sent in the email.
!image-2025-01-21-15-02-56-899.png|width=664,height=284! h3. Expected Results
The link in email should be [https://wiki.confluence.example.com/wiki/spaces/EXCEL/pages/281739275] h3. Actual Results
The link in the email is
[https://wiki.confluence.example.com/spaces/EXCEL/pages/281739275]

item.summary: Product Link tool updates the target of links on Confluence Pages, but not the display text of the link
item.description: h3. Issue Summary Currently, the Product Link fix tool on Cloud updates the target of links in Confluence pages, but not the display text of the link, like the following format; {noformat} /download/attachments/150306904/Test%20Document%202.docx?api=v2{noformat} h3. Steps to Reproduce 1. Post Confluence Migration, run the Product Links tool 2. Links in the format above should have the display text updated, however only the link in the anchor tag is updated. h3. Expected Results The Product Link Fix Tool should be capable of display text of links. h3. Actual Results Currently, The Product Link Fix Tool is not updating display text in links h3. Workaround To resolve this type of links issue, please reach out to Atlassian support for assistance.

item.summary: Deleting a space causes the automation rule's scope to change from single space to global
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary Deleting a space causes the automation rule's scope to change from single space to global.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create an automation rule and set its scope to a *single space* # Set the trigger to *Scheduled*; # Add a *Page branch*, example: Last updated more than 5 months ago; # Add the *Send email* action to something like this: "This is a reminder to update your content titled '{{page.title}}' at {{page.url}}. It has not been updated in the last 5 months."; # Turn on the rule and wait for it to run on its schedule. -- You should receive an email with pages matching the criteria you set in step 3, only pages from a single space. # *Delete the space* where the rule is; # Wait for the rule to run on its next schedule.
h3. Expected Results The automation rule shouldn't run(as the space is deleted) or its scope should remain on the single space you set.
h3. Actual Results The automation rule's scope is changed from single space to global and your *Page branch* criteria expands to all space, like a Global scope.
h3. Workaround [Restore the space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/delete-a-space/#Restore-a-space].

item.summary: Restricted pages not listed in the Space's Restricted Pages list
item.description:
h3. User Problem # When a "user group" that's used for page restriction is deleted; ** The restriction from the group still applies to the page. # The restriction does not show up in the Space's Restriction list ** !Space_Restricted_Content.png|thumbnail! ** Making it impossible for Space admins to even know that they exist, and how to fix them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Add a page view restriction to a page in Confluence, making sure to add a "user group" into the list of exemption. # Proceed to delete the "user group" from the site's user/groups management. ** {code:java}https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<SITE-ID>/groups{code} # Check on the Space's restriction list; ** {code:java}https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/listpermissionpages.action?key=<SPACE_KEY>{code} ** The "user group" will no longer be visible/listed. (x) # Remove the remaining restriction for the page from the restriction list ** {code:java}https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/listpermissionpages.action?key=<SPACE_KEY>{code} # Check on the page and it will still be restricted (x) ** !User_2_Page.png|thumbnail! # *Any Space admin:* Check on the restriction list, and there'll be no pages listed (x) ** !Space_Restricted_Content.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results * Restricted pages should be listed in the Space's restricted pages list, with the option for Space admins to remove them.
h3. Actual Results * Deleted user groups are not listed in the page's restriction option, or Space's Restriction list. * Making it impossible to unrestrict these pages without Site admins assistance using Admin Key (Confluence Premium only)
h3. Current Workarounds # *Option #1* - Contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] ** Referencing this bug, CONFCLOUD-80480, to apply a temporary fix which will display deleted user groups in a Space's restricted pages list ** {code}https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/listpermissionpages.action?key=<SPACE-KEY>{code} # *Option #2* - For Premium/Enterprise customers only ** Use the [admin key|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/bypass-access-restrictions-on-a-page-with-admin-key/] feature to view and remove all restrictions from a page.

comments.text:
As noted by our support team on this ticket, there is now a viable workaround that allows customers who wish to see deleted groups in the Restricted pages list for a space. You can contact Atlassian support referencing this ticket, CONFCLOUD-80480, to apply a fix which will display deleted user groups in a space's Restricted pages list.
Showing deleted groups on this screen is not the intended product experience, therefore, we are closing this ticket out.
comments.author: Marie Casabonne

item.summary: Home Page search box not working for Archived Spaces with custom Space Key
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting a Space Home Page is possible by navigating to {*}Space Settings > Space Details{*}, searching for a page under Home Page and clicking {*}Save{*}.
The Home Page search box does not display any results under a specific condition: * the Space is Archived * the Space Key is changed from it's original value
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps: # Create a new Space # Navigate to *Space Settings > Space Details* # Search for an existing page under Home Page (works) # Change the Space Key to a new value and click *Save* # Navigate to *Space Settings > Archive Space* # Click the *Archive Space* button # Navigate back to Space Details # Search for an existing page under Home Page (does not work)
h3. Expected Results
Space Admins can search for existing pages and set a new Space Home Page. h3. Actual Results
The Space Home Page search box does not display any results with a "No options" message. h3. Workaround
The available workarounds are: # Restore the Space from *Space Settings > Archive Space > Restore Space* # Change the Space Key back to its original value from *Space Settings > Space Details > Space Key*
PS: revery the changes done once the Space Home Page is changed.

item.summary: PDF export for large spaces consists unselected pages
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The PDF export feature for large spaces is not functioning correctly. When a user selects a specific page and its child pages for export, the resulting PDF includes pages that were not selected. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Access a large space. A space with at least 10,000 pages will suffice. # Got to space settings -> General -> Export space # Select PDF Export format -> Choose 'Select what to export' # Unselect the root page selection and do a search on the page(Cmd+F) and search for any page. # Select only this page and its child pages. # Click on Export # Download and verify the exported PDF file.
h3. Expected Results
Export the selected page and its child pages. h3. Actual Results
Exported results contain the pages that were not selected. h3. Workaround
Copy a page, along with its child pages, to another Confluence space, which can either be newly created or contain a limited number of pages. Then, export the pages to PDF from this new Confluence space.

item.summary: Database macro display a URL link instead of the embedded database/macro for the customer portal view in JSM
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary While it is possible to add a database macro and embedded database through a macro, when viewing the same Confluence pages where it is correctly working for licensed users, in the KB view as articles in the service desk portal as JSM customers, it is not possible to see the macro and it is displayed a URL link for the database instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a space and integrate with JSM to serve as a knowlegde base # Create a confluence page # Add a database macro # Create a new database or embedded an existing one # Login with a JSM customer account # Search for the page in the service desk portal as a customer
h3. Expected Results The embedded database or the content from the macro database displays as expected
h3. Actual Results There is only a link to the database macro/page
h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: discrepancy in the page orders seen in the Sidebar and via "Space Settings > Content > Reorder"
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There's a discrepancy in the page orders seen in the *sidebar* and via *Space Settings > Content > Reorder*
The issue occurs when we copy a page multiple times using the *sidebar* by clicking the meatball menu.
In the {*}sidebar{*}, the newly created pages will show up in the following order. * The newly created page would be above the page it was copied from ** if *page 2* was copied from {*}page 1{*}; then *page 3* was copied from *page 1* again. then it'd look like this *** page 2 *** page 3 *** page 1
In {*}Space Settings > Content > Reorder{*}; however, the pages would show up in a different order * The newly created page would show up below the page it was copied from. ** if *page 2* was copied from {*}page 1{*}; then *page 3* was copied from *page 1* again. then it'd look like this *** page 1 *** page 2 *** page 3
h3. Steps to Reproduce * Create some pages like this ** Parent *** page 1 **** page 1a **** page 1b * Using the *Meatball Menu > Copy* , make a copy of *page 1* with children and use "Replace title world" to create *page 2* * Repeat the same and make *page 3* from *page 1* * Observe the page orders in *sidebar* and *Space Settings > Content > Reorder*
h3. Expected Results
The order in both places should be identical h3. Actual Results
The order in both are different. But, if we click the alphabetical order button, then both places gets updated and shows consistent alphabetical ordering. h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: PDF export fails for large Confluence spaces with ~ 10k pages.
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PDF export of a space with more than 10K pages fails with the below message on UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Select Confluence space having [10k+ current pages]. # Navigate to Space settings > Export space > PDF > Click on Next
h3. Expected Results
The page is redirected to the next page "Export PDF Options" with the below options. # Export all pages, with attachments. Comments are excluded. # Select what to export
h3. Actual Results
The "Page unavailable" Error is shown on the UI.
!image-2024-12-03-19-05-32-004.png! h3. Workaround
Divide the space into multiple pages by copying or moving pages to a second space, then attempt the PDF export from the newly created spaces.

item.summary: A4C: Pages created via Automation with templates does not use the width set in the template
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary # When creating templates in Confluence, we can set the width of the template and pages created via it to be *"full width"*, or *"fixed width"*. ** Pages created manually using this template will use the width that's set in the template, regardless of the user's editor settings. # But pages created using automation will instead use the user/actor's width setting in their profile.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # First, create a template in the site or Space, and set the width for the template to "full width". # Create an automation that uses this template to create pages. For example: ** *Trigger:* Manual ** *Action:* Publish new page (with the template created above) # In the user's site settings, *"uncheck"* the "Enable full-width as the default for new pages" option. ** https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmyeditorsettings.action # As the same user, try to *create a new page manually* using the template. ** The page will be set to "full width" as what we've set in the template. (/) # With the same user, *trigger the automation to create the page*. ** The page will be created as "fixed-width" following the user's settings.
h3. Expected Results * Width set in the template should be used when pages are created using them.
h3. Actual Results * User's settings for editor is used for pages created using templates via Automation.
h3. Workaround * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: Updating Space detail throwing error Something went wrong
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the space has fairly large number of pages. Editing Space details can take long time and get times out resulting into 500 Internal error. We have seen this behavior with space that have ~5000 pages. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Navigate to Space settings >> Space Details >> Edit Space Details # Update Description or homepage or any other field and then Save
h3. Expected Results
Space Details should be updated. h3. Actual Results
It redirect to following error page and take longer than normal time to proceed but will eventually finish:
*UI Error* {code:java} Something went wrong. We're moving mountains to get it sorted. View our status page and subscribe for service updates.{code} *Browser Console Error* {code:java} Request URL:https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/doeditspace.action?key=<space-key> Request Method:POST Status Code:500 Internal Server ErrorRemote{code} h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

item.summary: Large PDF files gets cut off in the media viewer
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a large PDF document that is not following the standard document sizes (for example, exported diagrams from figma), the preview of the document when clicking it gets cut off
The issue seems to be related to the default zoom of the media viewer as zooming out resolves the issue h3. Steps to Reproduce # Attach a large PDF file in a Confluence page # Publish the page and view the attached PDF file
h3. Expected Results
PDF file can be viewed through the media viewer h3. Actual Results
PDF file can be viewed but it looks cut off h3. Workaround * Resize the PDF file to standard document sizes

item.summary: Page templates with an index parent page that are created under Folders are placed automatically outside
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pages created with templates that have a index page, like the meeting notes template, does not keep page created under the folder hierarchy and places the page outside folder, under the index parent page automatically. This does not happen if a page from the template is created as a children of another parent page.
This is extremely confusing as why it works with pages, but not with folders. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Access a space, and create a folder section # Under that folder, create a new page with the '{*}Meeting notes'{*} template by using the '{_}Quick Actions{_}' section at the bottom to choose the template or using button "{*}...{*}" then "{_}*Templates & import doc*{_}" to choose the template. # Create a second page without using the template, outside the folder/index page hierarchy # Create a children page under this parent page using the meeting notes template
h3. Expected Results
The page gets created successfully under that folder. h3. Actual Results
Page is placed automatically outside the folder and under the index page. h3. Workaround
Place the index page inside the folder section to have it created automatically under the folder hierarchy, or drag and drop the created meeting notes page under the folder manually.

item.summary: Tables inside Page Properties show unnecessary horizontal scroll bar
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are cases where nested tables inside Page Properties show horizontal bar even though the bar is not needed h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a Confluence Cloud page: * Create a layout with two columns * Create a table in one of the two columns of the layout * Create a Page properties macro inside the same column * Create a second table, this time inside the Page properties macro
!image-2024-10-30-15-50-42-728.png|width=512,height=224! h3. Expected Results
Both the tables are not scrollable given that there is enough space for the table content
h3. Actual Results
The table inside the Page Properties macro is scrollable, even if not necessary:
!image-2024-10-30-15-52-46-736.png|width=553,height=436! h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: Error occurs when inserting Jira objects into Team Calendars
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When numerous projects and filters exist on the Jira side, users are encountering timeout errors when attempting to add Jira Agile Sprints to Confluence Team Calendars. {code:java} java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out {code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Navigate to any space on Confluence that is linked to a Jira instance with a significant number of projects and filters. # Navigate to the Calendars section from the left sidebar. # Click on the Add Event button and select Jira Agile Sprints.
h3. Expected Results * It is expected that the Projects dropdown within the Add Event pop-up will be populated with the Jira Agile Sprints.
h3. Actual Results * If the user has access to multiple projects and filters are present on the Jira side, the Projects dropdown may not populate, resulting in a timeout error being observed. * Inspecting browser's Developer Tools, we can see the below request is returning HTTP 500 Internal Server Error: {code:java} https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/jira/<CalendarID>/query/options.json{code}
h3. Workaround:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: Custom Space export times out on building the page tree
item.description:

When performing a custom space export for a huge space (>2000 pages), building of the tree will hit a timeout and the custom export cannot proceed. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Identify a huge space # *Space Settings > Export Space > HTML > Select what to export*
h3. Expected Results
The page tree should be loaded and the user can choose which pages to export. h3. Actual Results
The page tree never loads. In the backend, a Gateway Timeout (504) can be seen when trying to load the page url=wiki/spaces/exportspacetree.action?key=SPACEKEY h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: Confluence - Add a Label inside a brach for confluence cloud results in multiple labels with the same name
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an automation is triggered to process multiple pages inside a branch and then add a *new* label, there might be a chance of creating multiple labels with the same name but different ids causing issues while you want to find those pages h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create an automation # Add related entities branch # Add a CQL example = "type=page" # Inside the branch add action "Add label" create a new label # Run the automation as test
h3. Expected Results
At the database level we should have only one entry for each label name, however, multiple entries are found h3. Actual Results
When a label has not been created and must be done inside the automation branch multiple labels with the same and different ids are name are created h3. Workaround
Create the label and link it to a page, then run the automation.
*Notes:*
There was an old bug that is already resolved, I tried to replicate it but it is not possible
[https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-73005]

item.summary: Smart link of Box custom domain (<company>.box.com) open previews with URL app.box.com

item.summary: Confluence AI summary defaults to English when used with Confluence Automation
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary # AI summaries in Confluence is meant to use [user's preferred language|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-76852] that is set in their [Atlassian account preference|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] # This works as expected when using the AI summary on a page directly. # But if the AI summary is used via Confluence Automation to send email summaries, it is sent in English. ** {{page.aiSummary}} ** {{blog.aiSummary}}
h3. Steps to Reproduce # In a Confluence site, edit the Global default language to be anything other than English; ** https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/configuration # In the Atlassian account preference page below, change the prefered language to match the above; ** https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences # Refresh Confluence, and visit any page, confirming that the AI summary is in the prefered language that's set in the user profile. # Create a simple automation in Confluence, to trigger an AI summary email. For example; ## Trigger: Adding a label ## Action: Send email ## Add a user email, and in the email, use one of the AI summary smart values below; *** {{page.aiSummary}} # Now trigger the automation by adding the label to the page from before. # The email will be sent with the AI summary of the page, in English.
h3. Expected Results # The AI summary sent via automation should follow the language that the user has set in their profile. # Or at least, the language of the content on the page.
h3. Actual Results * Regardless of the following items below, the AI summary sent from Automation will always be in English. ## Content language ## Site language ## User profile language
h3. Workaround * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

item.summary: "Copy link to heading" in edit mode uses URL from the editor

item.summary: Confluence Storage Format Links Incorrectly Create New Pages Instead of Handling Moved or Renamed Targets in Migrated Instances
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Migration is a long process, usually executed moving and validating few spaces per time. During the migration process, pages can be moved or renamed, causing the target links to fail with "Page not found error".
However, when the link is using Confluence Storage Format, when hitting the link it tries to create a new page on the target space, instead of be smart to redirect to the new location or title name (ideally) or show a Page note found error, with the suggestion of the new location/new title. h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Confluence On-Prem with: Spaces A and the pages: "A page 1" Spaces B and the pages: "B page 2", "B page 3" Spaces C and the pages: "C page 2", "C page 3"
2. Edit "A Page 1" on Space A to add links to the pages on space B and C;
3. Hit the Link icon again, but select "search" and search for the pages "B page 2" and "C page 2". Observe that the link created will use the Confluence Storage Format: {code:java} <ac:link><ri:page ri:space-key="spaceB" ri:content-title="B page 2" /></ac:link> <ac:link><ri:page ri:space-key="spaceC" ri:content-title="C page 2" /></ac:link> {code} 4. Copy and paste the URL from "B page 3" and "C page 3". Observe that the link created will also use the Confluence Storage Format: {code:java} <ac:link><ri:page ri:space-key="spaceB" ri:content-title="B page 3" /></ac:link> <ac:link><ri:page ri:space-key="spaceC" ri:content-title="C page 3" /></ac:link> {code} 5. Migrate space A to Cloud using the Migration Assistance
6. On Cloud, reach space A, "A page 1". Observe that: * The target links remains on the same "A page 1" (!)
7. Migrate space C to Cloud using the Migration Assistance
9. On Cloud, reach space A, "A page 1". Observe that: * Target links for the pages "C page 2" and "C page 3" now are working properly, opening the pages on space C.
10. On the On-Prem environment, rename the pages on space B to "B renamed page 2", "B renamed page 3"
11. Migrate space B to Cloud using the Migration Assistance
12. On Cloud, reach space A, "A page 1". h3. Expected results
It is expected to be redirected to "B renamed page 2" (ideally) or show "Page not found" error with the suggestion to the renamed page. h3. Actual Results
it opens a new draft page with the same previous tile on Space B h3. Workaround
Remove the link and add again to the renamed page
note: Same issue observed when moving the page to another space, instead of renaming.

comments.text: FYI. Running Link fixing should resolve this problem after migration.

item.summary: Page Ownership Issue After Editor Conversion in Confluence Cloud
item.description:
h4. Issue Summary
After converting pages from the legacy editor to the new editor in Confluence Cloud, the recently updated page owner is incorrectly reverting to the original page owner or creator. h4. Steps to Reproduce # User A create a new legacy page # User A change owner of Page to User B # User A edit and convert the page to fabric. # Page Owner changed back to original creator User A.
h4. Expected Results
After conversion, User B should retain ownership of the page. h4. Actual Results
After Conversion, system inaccurately assigns ownership back to original creator of legacy page, leading to discrepancies in user ownership. h4. Workaround
Target user can create a copy of the legacy editor page first and convert it instead. However, it's crucial to note that this workaround does not retain the page history, posing limitations on version tracking.

item.summary: Confluence Automation fails to update page status when the scope is set to multiple spaces
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence Automation fails to update page status when the scope is set to multiple spaces h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a custom status with the same name and color on two separate spaces # Create an automation rule, with the following steps: ** *Branch rule / related entities* - CQL=type = page ** *Action - Change page status* - Select the custom status created on the first step # On the rule's details, select scope as "Multiple spaces" and list the two spaces you created the custom status on # Save the rule # Run the rule
h3. Expected Results
The rule will sweep all pages on each of both spaces and add the custom status to all pages h3. Actual Results
The rule will fail to change the page status from one of the spaces. When selecting the status on the action "Change page status", the list will be populated with all statuses from all spaces in scope, comparing their name and color, but not their ID. The custom status will be listed only once from one space. When the rule is run, it uses the custom status ID to update the pages. This will work for all pages in one space, but it won't find that status ID for the pages in the other space.
*Error:* We can’t run a rule relating to page status on a global scope. Select Rule details and change the Scope field to one or more space. h3. Workaround
Create an automation rule for each space, instead of selecting multiple space scope

comments.text: A corollary to this: when exporting/importing Confluence Cloud Automation rules that utilize page statuses, the page statuses must be manually created first in each space, then the imported rule must be edited to update the align the status IDs that are specific to that space (and are different from the status IDs in the export).

item.summary: Intermittent discrepancy in task status between Confluence Cloud page and backend
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The task status on the Confluence Cloud page sometimes shows as 'done', but the actual status in the backend, specifically in the task table, is shown as 'unchecked'. This discrepancy is intermittent and is generally observed when a task is checked, unchecked, and then checked again. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Navigate to the Confluence Cloud page. # Find a task and check its status. # publish the page
h3. Expected Results
The task status on the Confluence Cloud page and the actual status in the backend should be consistent. If a task is marked as 'done' on the Confluence Cloud page, it should also be marked as 'checked' in the backend h3. Actual Results
The task status on the Confluence Cloud page sometimes shows as 'done', but the actual status in the backend, specifically in the task table, is shown as 'unchecked'. This discrepancy is intermittent and is generally observed when a task is checked, unchecked, and then checked again h3. Workaround
Update the bug status via backend or API call

item.summary: Unable to delete inline comments on pages with certain macros being used
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It appears that on pages with certain macros (for example the {*}Excerpt{*}, {*}Page Properties{*}, or *ToC* macro) being used, the "{*}Delete{*}" button on inline comments does not appear. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page that has both plain text AND either an {*}Excerpt{*}, *Page Properties* or *ToC* macro in it. # Leave an inline comment or two on the plain text of the page. # Click on the inline comment and try to delete it.
h3. Expected Results
You will see the "{*}Delete{*}" button and be able to remove the inline comment. h3. Actual Results
The "{*}Delete{*}" button is not displayed. h3. Workaround
Remove the macro, update the page, delete the inline comment, and add back the macro.
Alternatively, create a new page without those macros and add an inline comment. Confirm the "Delete" button appears for the comments on this new page, then navigate to the original page (without refreshing the browser). The "Delete" button should now appear.

item.summary: Failed to parse XHTML content from Jira Macro Repair
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When updating pages to fix broken macros (such as in Jira Macro Repair), user generated content needs to be parsed, updated, and then saved. Due to errors in the format of the XHTML, it's possible some pages cannot be parsed or saved, causing the content fixing to fail.
This is reproducible on Data Center: _with suitable samples of XHTML_ h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A h3. Expected Results
Pages should be able to be parsed and saved. h3. Actual Results
Some pages fail when being parsed or being updated.
+*Troubleshooting*+
When parsing fails, this log entry is logged from Jira Macro Repair: {noformat} Failed to parse content on page{noformat} or {code:java} Skipping page update due to parsing error.{code}
Use these steps to find these failed update entries * First run this Splunk query with the cloud ID of the tenant:
{{"<cloudId>" `connie-prod` "ValidatorMessageRunner"}} * Use the *trace ID* from one of the logs ({_}*ext.traceId*{_}) with the following Splunk query:
{{"<traceId>" `connie-prod` level=ERROR | stats count by message}} * There can be several traceId values to work through
*The error stack trace exception will show* {code:java} com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (Cannot invoke "javax.xml.stream.events.Attribute.getValue()" because "macroNameAttribute" is null) ... Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "javax.xml.stream.events.Attribute.getValue()" because "macroNameAttribute" is null{code}
h3. Workaround
Please reach out to Atlassian Support.

Large XML space exports may result in the UI not displaying the download link, even though the export was completed successfully. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Export a large space ~150GB+ to XML # The export will progress and then appear to be stuck # The export completes in the backend, but no download link is ever displayed

item.summary: Multiple legacy Jira issue macros on a page with combined results exceeding 1000 results in performance degradation
item.description:

Change the macros to use the new Jira List of Links Macro. [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-jira-issues-macro/]

item.description:
h3. Issue Summary In the new editing experience, we're able to use Smart Links with a variety of links, such as google drive, dropbox, figma and box links.
However, even though it works for app.box.com links to be rendered as smart links if the same are pasted from the share copy link, the same don't work if the link is not from the share link on box.com and if the link has the name of the company, such as companyname.box.com/s/filename instead of app.box.com/s/filename, the links doesn't render as smart links.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page # Paste a link from box.com from the share file link that has the similar link companyname.box.com/s/filename # With the same URL link, replace the companyname with the "app" word, it should be like app.box.com/s/filename
h3. Expected Results Both URLs links are valid and render as Smart Links
h3. Actual Results Only the link as app.box.com/s/filename render as a Smart Link
h3. Workaround Replace the companyname.box.com to use the app.box.com to render it as a smart link or use the ctrl + k (link macro) to enter the link a name to the file link shared.

item.summary: Migrated Jira macros do not show columns for custom fields in edit view
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After migrating Confluence pages that contain Jira macros the edit page does not show the columns for custom fields but those columns still render. Example below. No columns are shown in the edit view except "status" but the columns still render in the macro:
!image-2023-10-03-16-47-20-208.png|width=922,height=644!
!image-2023-10-03-16-47-31-156.png|width=923,height=108!
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create Jira macro onprem inside Confluence page # Migrate page to cloud # Edit Jira macro and review Confluence columns
h3. Expected Results
All columns in use should show in the edit view h3. Actual Results
Custom fields are not shown in the edit view. Running Jira macro repair or redindexing has no effect on this behavior. This is because the custom field id's have changed during migration.
h3. Workaround
Removing all custom fields from a macro and leaving only one built-in field, status for example, and then readding all the custom fields will show them correctly in the edit view going forward. This requires manual editing of all Jira macros however which is not scalable.

item.summary: Moving pages between spaces breaks images with links
item.description:
h3. Summary
This issue only happens when moving multiple pages at the same time and is consistently reproducible.
When moving a page tree between two spaces, if one of the pages contains {*}attachments with links pointing to pages within the same page tree{*}, the attachments will break.
*Please view attached screen recording to follow steps to reproduce.*
The move page with has the proper source code like the screenshot below, but still shows "unknown attachment"
!image-2023-09-18-10-37-23-999.png!
h3. Environment * Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create page page tree. Here's an example: {code:java} Parent page ├─ Child page 1 ├─ Child page 2 └─ Child page 3{code} 2. Add attachments to the parent page.
3. Copy the link from the child pages.
4. Add the links from the child pages to each of the attachments.
5. Move the page tree to a different space.
h3. Expected Results
The attachments shouldn't break h3. Actual Results
The attachments containing links to pages that were moved together will break. They display as "Unknown Attachments".
!image-2022-08-25-14-10-26-352.png|width=226,height=218! h3. Workaround
There are two ways to prevent this issue from happening: # Users can move the pages individually. That is, first move the page containing the attachments with links, then the other pages. # Make a copy of the pages instead of moving them. Depending on the scenario, that's not a good choice as the author of the page will change and the page history will be lost.
h3. Note
This issue is very similar to the behavior described on CONFCLOUD-63034.

item.summary: Converting a template from the legacy to the current editor will not work
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When spaces or global templates are using the legacy editor, there will have an option to convert it so they can use the current/new editor of Confluence.
Depending on how the edit mode for them is structured, a different result will happen, but, the template will not get converted. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Make sure to have templates that were created with the legacy editor. # On a space that has the template, the *Convert* option {*}may or may not be displayed{*}. # Tap the *Convert* button is visible and confirm the conversion after the preview.
h3. Expected Results
After the preview and confirmation, the template should be converted to the new/current editor. h3. Actual Results * *Convert button Not available* * If tapping the *Edit* button of the template redirects to the legacy editor mode ([https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/templates2/editpagetemplate.action?entityId=ID_HERE&key=SPACE_KEY]), upon tapping the *Convert* button, a message stating that the conversion has worked will be displayed, but the template will still use the legacy editor: !success_template.png|thumbnail! * If the edit mode automatically has the template in the new/current editor ([https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACE_KEY/templates/edit/TEMPLATE-ID]), upon tapping the *Convert* button, a message stating that the template could not be found will be displayed: !not_found.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround * When convert button is not available manually re-create the template using the current/new editor * For the scenarios where the "edit" button redirects to the new/current editor, use the "Edit" button and publish the template, which will convert it to the new editor. * For the scenarios where the "edit" button will redirect to the legacy one, manually re-create the template using the current/new editor

item.summary: Changes made to a draft with REST API won't take effect on the editor
In-editor inline comments don't show within third-party macros
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the new inline comments feature, working on Confluence got easier with the possibility to add these comments from within the editor. Though that's a great feature, it seems it is not working well when an inline comment is being added within a third-party macro. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Install one of the below third-party add-ons on Confluence (for example): ** [Numbered Headings|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/16063/numbered-headings?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]; ** [Table Filter and Charts for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27447/table-filter-and-charts-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]; ** [Content Formatting Macros for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/247/content-formatting-macros-for-confluence?hosting=cloud] # Create a new page; # Insert a macro from one of the installed add-ons; # After typing some text within the macros, add an inline comment somewhere in this text; # Publish the page.
h3. Expected Results
The inline comment is being shown in the text. h3. Actual Results
No inline comment can be seen.
*Notes*: * It might be happening with other different third-party macros - the 2 mentioned above are just as an example, since they were macros we tested this behavior; * From the published page, if we add {{?focusedCommentId=COMMENT_ID#comment-COMMENT_ID}} at the end of the URL, the comment gets shown at the right side of the screen.
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior, but removing the content from within the macros will get the inline comment shown in the text.

comments.text:
As we use inline commenting more and more, we noticed that it works with (3rd party, for example the scroll exporter extensions for cloud.) macros in the editing mode of a page, but not after the page is published.
This is very confusing for our users. In editing mode, it is only useful for some situations. You can't see the comments if you look at the published page or add comments to a published page.
As we use inline commenting more and more, this significantly impacts the usefulness of Confluence for our users.

Creating a new product (Jira, Jira Service Management, or Confluence) in an existing sandbox is blocked if there are apps with expired licenses in the sandbox instance. When attempting to add a new product, the following error occurs: "Sandbox creation failed. Try to create your sandbox again. If this keeps happening, contact support." h3. Steps to Reproduce # Access the sandbox creation area and product addition section within the sandbox via {_}[https://admin.atlassian.com/o/]<YOUR ORG ID>/sandbox{_}. # Click on "Add" to attempt adding a new product. # Select the product you want to add to your sandbox site. # Click on "Add"
h3. Expected Results
The new product should be successfully added to the existing sandbox without any errors. h3. Actual Results
An error message is displayed: "Sandbox creation failed. Try to create your sandbox again. If this keeps happening, contact support." !Sandbox_error_create.png|width=244,height=102! h3. Workaround
*Investigation from the user interface:* # Access the sandbox creation area and product addition section within the sandbox via {_}[https://admin.atlassian.com/o/]<YOUR ORG ID>/sandbox{_}. # Before clicking "{*}Add{*}" to add a new product, open the *browser's developer tools* by right-clicking and selecting "{*}Inspect{*}". # Navigate to the "{*}Network{*}" tab. # Click on "Add" to attempt to add a new product. # Select the product you want to add to your sandbox site. # Click on "Add" # If there are issues with expired app licenses, observe an HTTP status code: 409 Conflict on the browser's developer tools. # Open the error and on the tab *Response* see the results as follows:
{code:java} { "additionalData": { "expiredApps": [ { "name": "App example name", "expiryDate": "2025-03-01" } ], ... }, "errorCode": 100, "message": "Account contains one or more expired applications.", "reason": "ACCOUNT_EXPIRED" } {code} *To resolve this issue:* # Reinstall the apps that have expired licenses in the current sandbox. # Unsubscribe from any trial licenses associated with these apps. # Uninstall the apps after unsubscribing. # Attempt to create a new product in your sandbox again.

Select the user from "Names or emails" list and [Add] does not trigger the user invitation. So the added user is listed in [Project settings] > [People], but they are not added to the site and granted the product access. They can't access to the project until the product access is granted.
Even the [User access settings > User invites|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/control-how-users-get-access-to-products/#User-invites] is configured as invite anyone, invite is not triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # In the single org, there are 2 sites (Site A & B). User X is project admin for site A, and User Y is product user of site B # User X add the User Y to the project via [Project settings] > [People] > [Add people] > Selecting "Names or emails" list # User Y is not received the invitation, and checking the User Y product access in admin.atlassian.com, product access for Site A is not granted.
h3. Expected Results Adding the user who belongs to same org should trigger the user invitation based on user access settings.
h3. Actual Results Adding the user who belongs to same org does not trigger user invitation.
h3. Workaround
Add product access via admin.atlassian.com > [Directory] > [Users], and then add to the project

item.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to deactivate or delete Data Security Policies, the following error is occurring. {code:java} We're unable to deactivate the policy We're not sure what went wrong. Try again. {code} The error occurred because the data security policy was applied to a sandbox in the past, which was later deleted. We can observe the error below in the browser Developer Tools.
{*}Path{*}: [https://admin.atlassian.com/gateway/api/admin/v1/orgs/********/policies/********]
{*}Response{*}: {code:java} { "timestamp": "2024-08-26T11:06:08.706+00:00", "path": "/api/admin/v1/orgs/********/policies/*************", "status": 400, "error": "Bad Request", "requestId": "*******-********", "errors": [ { "id": "*************", "status": "400", "code": "ERROR_*********", "title": "Products don't belong to site", "detail": "Product [confluence] does not belong to any site owned by Organization [**************]" } ] }{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Data Security Policy. # Set up the policy to be enforced on both a production site and a sandbox site. # Remove the sandbox site where the policy has been enforced. # Try to deactivate or deleted the data security policy.

item.summary: "Create Group" REST API failed with XSRF check failed

comments.text:
This is not a bug, but a security practice enforced by the common security layer in Bitbucket.
POST requests are vulnerable to CSRF attacks and as security best practice the common security layer enforces CSRF validation if no content type is specified.
When content-type of `application/json` is specified, and the fact that the request is not coming from a browser, this CSRF validation is bypassed and the REST endpoint is allowed to process the request.
I will raise a documentation improvement ticket to add a note about this behaviour in the [Errors & Validation section|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/bitbucket/rest/v905/intro/#errors---validation] for the Forbidden 403 response code.
comments.author: David Zhu

item.summary: Using LDAP_MATCHING_RULE_IN_CHAIN OID for nested group membership stopped working
item.description:
h3. Issue Summary This is reproducible on Data Center: yes
Users synced from Microsoft AD lose all the group membership after upgrading Bitbucket from any version prior to 8.19.x to 9.x.
h3. Steps to Reproduce # Install Bitbucket 8.19.x. # Set up Microsoft AD with nested groups. {noformat} CN=moga,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group1,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group2,OU=ou2,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group3,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group6,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group4,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group5,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group4,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com memberOf: CN=group6,OU=ou1,DC=example,DC=com {noformat} # Create a user directory in Bitbucket with the following configuration: {noformat} ldap.basedn: DC=example,DC=com ldap.group.dn: OU=ou1 ldap.nestedgroups.disabled: true ldap.group.usernames=member: 1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941: ldap.user.group: memberOf: 1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941: ldap.usermembership.use: true ldap.usermembership.use.for.groups: true {noformat} # Sync the directory and observe the behaviour; user moga will have the following membership: #* group1 #* group3 #* group4 #* group5 #* group6 # Upgrade the instance to Bitbucket 9.0.x. # Perform the directory sync and observe the behaviour - the user will not belong to any user groups.
h3. Expected Results The user moga should have the following group membership: * group1 * group3 * group4 * group5 * group6
h3. Actual Results The user moga have no group memberships.
h3. Workaround This is happening due to a change in Crowd sync on Crowd 5.3.0; [Crowd 5.3 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-5-3-upgrade-notes-1388151831.html]; LDAP synchronization improvements. The workaround is to disable the new sync: # Add the following in <bitbucket installation path>/bin/_start-webapp.sh: {noformat} JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dcrowd.use.legacy.ad.membership.sync=true" {noformat} # Restart Bitbucket. # Initiate the sync.
